text.p: Write a piece of Python code that, given a positive integer N (e.g. 27 or 64), finds the cube root of N and prints it if N is a perfect cube or prints error if N is not a perfect cube. To do so, write a loop that increments a counter until the cube of the counter is equal to N.
For problems such as these, do not include input statements or define variables we said you are given. Our graders will provide values for you, so write your code assuming they are already defined.
